"How many children there are in the crowded cities who have not even a spot of green grass to set their feet upon. If they could be 
                                                                           42
educated in the country, amid the beauty, peace, and purity of nature, it would seem to them the spot nearest heaven. In the retired places, where we are farthest from the corrupting maxims, customs, and excitements of the world, and nearest to the heart of nature, Christ makes his presence real to us, and speaks to our souls of his peace and love."-- Idem, pp. 46, 47.
